subject: Re: [PATCH 2/2] mm: memcontrol: switch to native NR_VMALLOC vmstat counter

reviews.author: Johannes Weiner (author)
reviews.summary: The author is addressing a concern about the removal of MEMCG_VMALLOC from memcg_stat_items and memory_stats[]. They acknowledged that it was an oversight and will re-add NR_VMALLOC to these arrays in v2, ensuring consistent accounting.

reviews.author: Shakeel Butt
reviews.summary: Reviewer Shakeel Butt pointed out that the NR_VMALLOC vmstat counter is not being updated correctly in the vmap_notify_list, specifically when a new allocation is made, and requested that the update be moved to the correct location.
reviews.raw_body:
On Fri, Feb 20, 2026 at 02:10:34PM -0500, Johannes Weiner wrote:
[...]

reviews.author: Shakeel Butt
reviews.summary: Reviewer Shakeel Butt pointed out that the mod_node_page_state() function requires a struct pglist_data pointer as its first argument, and suggested using page_pgdat(page) to obtain this pointer.
reviews.raw_body:
mod_node_page_state() takes 'struct pglist_data *pgdat', you need to use
page_pgdat(page) as first param.

reviews.author: Shakeel Butt
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that the patch description should be updated to include an Acked-by tag for themselves and requested it be added.
reviews.raw_body:
Same here.

With above fixes, you can add:

Acked-by: Shakeel Butt <shakeel.butt@linux.dev>

reviews.author: Uladzislau Rezki
reviews.summary: The reviewer suggested moving *_node_page_stat() calls to a single, consistent location in vm_area_alloc_pages(), specifically at the end or before splitting high-order pages, to avoid unnecessary looping over small pages.
reviews.raw_body:
Can we move *_node_page_stat() to the end of the vm_area_alloc_pages()?

Or mod_node_page_state in first place should be invoked on high-order
page before split(to avoid of looping over small pages afterword)?

I mean it would be good to place to the one solid place. If it is possible
of course.

--
Uladzislau Rezk

reviews.author: Johannes Weiner (author)
reviews.summary: Author acknowledged a mistake in their patch compilation and apologized for it.
reviews.raw_body:
Good catch, my apologies. Serves me right for not compiling
incrementally.
